intro: Cycnium decumbens, commonly known as the prostrate horse-hoof, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of less than 10 centimeters. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces, and it produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Cycnium decumbens is adapted to arid environments and is considered a minor weed in some regions.
